intro: Kadsura scandens var. cauliflora, commonly known as the climbing kadsura, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its woody stems and heart-shaped leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters along the stems. It is a member of the Aristolochiaceae family, known for its unique floral structures. The cauliflorous habit, where flowers and fruits develop from the trunk or branches, is a distinctive botanical feature of this species.
